div.sent: There are many problems of social life in Bangladesh.
Some of them are poverty, growth of population, illiteracy, superstition and the custom of dowry.
The economic and social advancement of the country is hindered by these social problems.
These problems should be resisted and solved.
For this a massive social movement should be launched and the existing laws should be properly enforced.
One of many social problems in our country is the custom of dowry.
The exchange of dowry is prohibited in the marriage law of the country.
Still in most of the marriages, the groom's side takes dowry from the bride's side.
The money or property that the groom or the bride demands and receives from the opposite side during marriage is called dowry.
In present Bangladesh, almost in all cases the groom's side demands dowry from the bride's side.
Few marriages take place without dowry.
It has turned into a social ill.
Dowry is an ancient custom.
In ancient China, the bride used to carry dowry to husband's house after marriage.
In Athens too the bride after marriage used to take money and property to husband's house.
Dowry was considered a social dignity there.
In present Bangladesh, dowry is the money, property and many kinds of valuable furniture and articles given to the groom in marriage.
But in the marriage law of Bangladesh, both giving and receiving of dowry are prohibited.
Dowry is a practice in all social sects of Bangladesh.
Many problems have been created in social life due to dowry.
The main reason behind torture and violence to married women is dowry.
The wife is humiliated in the husband's house due to dowry.
If the demand of dowry is not met, often the wife is forced to leave the husband's house.
Divorce and in some cases, the loss of wife's life occurs because of dowry.
In Bangladesh, custom of dowry is a deadly social disease.
Many reasons are behind this.
But poverty is supposed to be the main cause of this problem.
The groom's side demand money from the bride's side because of poverty.
The groom wants to be established utilizing the money and property of the bride's father.
Most women in this country are engaged in domestic work at their own homes and as such do not earn anything.
They live as dependent in husbands family.
Such women most often suffer humiliation and torture by husbands.
Many wealthy people in Bangladesh give huge dowry in their daughters marriage.
Wealthy parents believe that daughters will live heads high in husbands house because of the dowry they take with them.
For this reason too, the custom of dowry has taken a deep root in social mind.
There is law against dowry in our country.
Wife-torturing in demand of dowry is increasing because many times this law is not properly enforced.
The events of post marriage conjugal quarrel, torture, murder of wife and divorce happen because of dowry.
This dowry problem is at the root of poverty, corruption, crime tendency, early marriages and polygamy in society.
We should remember that both giving and receiving dowry are equal crimes.
In Muslim Family Law mohrana in marriage is not considered dowry.
Besides, marriage gift up to 500 Taka will not be considered dowry.
But at present, exchange of dowry in marriage has increased in a large scale.
For this, anti-dowry act was passed in1980 in Bangladesh.
According to this act, highest one year imprisonment or a fine of five thousand taka can be the punishment for giving or receiving dowry.
The judge can give both the punishments together.
The accomplice will get the same punishment too.
To marry a woman against her will and receiving dowry have also come under the provision of severe punishment.
Dowry has created a massive problem in family and society in Bangladesh.
We have to be conscious in order to be free from the evil effects of this custom.
To resist dowry, the first thing is to make the family conscious.
We should abstain from giving and receiving dowry.
At the same time we have to make our neighbours conscious about this.
If necessary, we have to take recourse to law.
We have to motivate all in family including the female child to take higher education.
If they are self dependent, the curse of dowry cannot touch them.
If we want to remain free from the clutches of dowry, we have to make all in society along with our family members conscious.
For this, it is necessary to build up anti-dowry social movement.
Social movement is organised social resistance.
Everyday incidences like illiteracy, poverty, torture of women, hijacking and divorce occur around us.
Behind many of these incidences, there is the demand of dowry.
We have to make our neighbours along with people in the locality, ward and village conscious about the bad effects of dowry.
We have to call everybody to come forward to resist this bad custom.
We have to create anti-dowry attitude in everybody's mind in society.
If we can build up an anti-dowry organization, we can be free from this social problem.
This organization will stand by victims of dowry and provide them all assistance along with legal assistance.
Besides, this organization can hold anti-dowry meetings, road marches and rallies.
Thus, consciousness will grow in people and our society will be saved from the claws of dowry.
